messages.text: Text
What do you want to know today? Me kuke so ku sani?
Ku ziyarci asibiti mafi kusa don cire IUD. Komawa ga haihuwa yana faruwa nan take, ko kuma yana iya ɗaukar sati ɗaya ko biyu. A mafi yawan lokuta, za ku iya yin ciki a farkon zagaye bayan cirewa.
Would you like to ask more questions?
The pill stops your body from ovulating, but as soon as you stop taking the pill, Your ovulation will start again . So, it's possible to get pregnant as soon as you stop the pill .nbsp

In most cases, it's possible to become pregnant after 3 months , but it usually takes several additional months for the complete effect of the hormone to wear off and to begin ovulating and having regular periods again.
Wani lokaci ana iya warware tsarin tsayawar mace. Za a iya yin hakan nan take ko kuma bayan shekaru da dama. Don Allah ku ziyarci mai ba da lafiya don shawarwari.
I can refer you to a clinic if you would like to adopt this method.
Do you want me to refer you to a clinic where you can get this method?
Ok, Please can you confirm that your current state is Statenbsp

Choose from the list of clinics in your state and nearest local government, the one you would like to visit. Note that these are clinics in partnership with DKT to offer family planning services. Before you visit the clinic, call 7790 to speak to an agent for more guidance and direction.
Did I answer your question?
Great, I am happy that I was of great service to you.
If you want to speak to an agent for further enquiries and discussion, please call 7790.
Can I help you with anything else?

nbspKindly visit a nearby clinic to remove the Implant.. The earliest possible time to get pregnant isnbsp within 1 weeknbsp of having the rod removed, but usually fertility is fully restored within 3 weeks .
Wani lokaci ana iya warware tsarin tsayawar namiji. Za a iya yin hakan nan take ko kuma bayan shekaru da dama. Don Allah ku ziyarci mai ba da lafiya don shawarwari.
This is great! I am happy to give you advice on family planning.nbsp Are you currently using a family planning method or did you recently use one?

Yawancin ma'aurata za su yi ciki cikin shekara guda idan suna yin jima'i akai-akai kuma ba sa amfani da kayan hana haihuwa. Amma wannan yana bambanta tsakanin mutane kuma yana dogara da abubuwa da yawa.
Have you removed the IUD for more than a year and still can not get pregnant?
How long have you been trying to get pregnant?

I see! No worries, getting pregnant might take some more time. However, we understand it might be frustrating. Kindly visit your health care provider to get more information. Would you like to ask more questions?
Sorry to hear that! Would you like me to connect you to a human agent or do you want to talk about something else?
Have you removed the implant for more than 3 months and still can not get pregnant?
Have you stopped taking the injection for more than 6 months and still can not get pregnant?
Have you stopped taking the pill for more than 3 months and still can not get pregnant?
Would you like to leave feedback for us?nbsp This will help us to improve the project and help more people.nbsp
I understand it might be frustrating, so it might be good to talk to a specialist and get more detailed advice.nbspnbsp

We understand it might be frustrating,but no worries, getting pregnant might take some more time. You can call a call center agent on 7790 to get more information. Would you like to ask more questions?
Kindly Visit the clinic where you adopted the method or a nearby clinic to remove it. Would you like me to refer you to a nearby clinic?

I understand that it might be frustrating. But no worries,nbsp women who stop using the injection usually experience at least 6 months of delay before pregnancy depending on your body it may be longer.
I understand that it might be frustrating. But no worries,nbsp women who stop using the Pills experience no delay in getting pregnant. You can visit a doctor if you still have concernsnbsp
Here are some of the effective and available lubricants and gels. Click on any of them to get their full details.

Fiesta Gels are classy and smooth, with a wet sensation for heightened sexual pleasure. How to Use Pour a small amount of Fiesta Intim natural gel on your palm and apply directly on your erect penis. For extra pleasure, you can also apply on the woman's intimate area.
You can purchase it at your nearest pharmacy or health shop.
KY Jelly is a water-based, fragrance-free, non-greasy formula that quickly prepares you for sexual intimacy amp eases the discomfort of personal dryness.
You can visit your nearest chemist/pharmacy to buy.
You can buy it at any pharmacy or health store around you.
What would you like to do next?
Call 7790 for free to speak to a counsellor

Lubricants, also called gels or lubes, are special fluids used during sex. They help reduce friction, discomfort, and dryness, making sex more pleasurable and preventing condoms from breaking. Lubricants come in water-based, silicone-based, or oil-based types. Water-based lubes are safe with all condoms, they don't change the vagina's pH, don't stain clothes, and wash off easily with water. Silicone and oil-based lubes should only be used with specific condom materials. Click to listen to a short introduction of Lubricant in Pidgin, if you want.

nbspPenegra is a product that used to treat erectile dysfunction. Erectile Dysfunction refers to the consistent/inability of a man to obtain an erection sufficient for satisfactory sex. Penegra helps to induce a hard erection which can last for an extended duration thereby enhancing confidence, well-being, and satisfaction. Penegra only induces a hard erection when the penis is stimulated.
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Penegra in Pidgin, if you want to.
You can click to watch a video on how to use this lubricant in Pidgin.
Sex can be enjoyed more with lubricants and gels. Hard erection can also be induced for more pleasured sex. What do you want to learn more about?

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills. Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately nbspafter unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy. Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms). Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills. Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor 2 is effective within 3 days . Which product do you want to learn about?
Allright. I am happy to provide you with more information about family planning methods that are effective and safe for you. For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

The short-term family planning methods are: 1. Daily contraceptive pills 2. The barrier contraceptives which are the nbspdiaphragms andnbsp Condoms 3. Injectables. Click on any of them to get the full details about them.
For how long do you want to prevent pregnancy?

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex. You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse. It doesnt work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is. You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome). They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released. Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).
Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes. Advantages 1. They are very effective if used correctly. 2. Very safe for the majority of women. 3. Return to fertility is very fast. 4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain. 5. They are simple and easy to use.

and Disadvantages 1. They must be taken daily which might be difficult to comply with. 2. They might cause mild and temporary side effect which usually goes away after some weeks such as: a. Mild headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Spotting or bleeding at intervals. d. Breast tenderness and soreness to touch. e. Mood changes.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills. Who can use 1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth) 3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle. 4. If you don't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure b. Venous thromboembolism c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease f. Breast Cancer g. Diabetes h. Sickle-cell Anaemia
Ok, it is not advisable for you to take daily pills. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.
Let me tell you some of the effective and available daily contraceptive pills. Click on any of them to get their full details.

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily.
You can buy Levofem at any pharmacy or health store around you.

How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills).
How to Use Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break.
How to Use One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy. The injectionnbspworks by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix. They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives. Advantages 1. They are highly effective and safe. 2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse. 3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel. 4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy. 5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis. 6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month.

Now to the disadvantages of injectable contraceptives. Disadvantages 1. They require regular visit to the to the clinic (monthly) 2. Return to fertility is delayed. 3.Their commom sides effects include: a. Weight changes. b. Headache. c. Dizziness. d. Breast tenderness. e. Mood changes. f. Menstrual change. g. Decreased libido.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?

On who can use and who cannot use injectables. Who can use 1. Women who cannot use combined oral contraceptives. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth) 3. If you just had an abortion or miscarriage and still want to prevent pregnancy. 4. If you dont't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Who cannot use 1. If you are a breastfeeding mother from 6 weeks to 6 months postpartum. 2. If you are a smoker and over 35 years old. 3. If you have any of the following medical conditions, it is not advisable to take daily piils: a. Blood Pressure. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Diabetes. h. Vascular Disease. i. Vaginal bleeding
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to adopt this method of contraception. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraceptive.
Let me tell you some of the effective and available Injectable contraceptives. Click on any of them to get their full details.

Progesta is an injectable contraceptive, a highly safe and effective contraceptive, injected intramuscularly and sometimes into the anus for 3 months continuously.nbsp Its mechanism of action are  thicken cervical mucus.  inhibits ovulation.  thins uterus walls to prevent ovulation.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Advantages of progesta includenbsp  Safe, highly effective, discontinued at will.  Long-acting,nbsp  Provided outside the clinic,nbsp  Reversible, easy to use, private, and non-contraceptive benefit.nbsp Users include heavy smokers, thyroid disorders, diabetes, those 18 years old or younger, breastfeeding mothers, and pelvic inflammatory diseases.nbsp

How to usenbsp  Injected in the upper arm or buttocks, start at any time during the menstrual cycle.nbsp  5 days after menstrual period, abstain from sex for the next 7 days.nbsp  It can be administered after abortion.nbsp  Start 6 weeks after delivery for a breastfeeding woman.
You can click on the audio below to listen to a short introduction of Sayana press in Pidgin, if you want to.
Sayana Press is indicated for long-term female contraception. Each subcutaneous injection prevents ovulation and provides contraception for at least 13 weeks
You can also click to watch a video on how to inject a Sayana Press in Pidgin.

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms. Advantages 1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects. 2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods. 3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion)nbsp 4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption.nbsp 5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control. 6. One size fits most women. 7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag. 8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice. 9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care.

andnbsp Disadvantages 1. They are not readily available in Nigeria. 2. They may be expensive to some users. 3. The user must remember to insert the diaphragm before intercourse and keep it in place for at least 6 hours after sex (but not more than 24 hours)nbsp 4. They require special care and storage. 5. They can cause urinary tract infections. 6. A different size of diaphragm may be required after childbirth or if a woman gains weight. 7. They can be damaged by excessive use or poor storagenbsp

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use diaphragms. Who can use 1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive. 2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons. 3. If you are breastfeeding. 4. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally.

Who cannot use 1. If you have an allergy or are sensitive to latex rubber or spermicide. 2. If you have severe uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina) 3. If have recurrent urinary tract infections. 4. If you lack facilities (soap and water) to taking care of the diaphragm.
Ok, let me show you what a diaphragm looks like and how to use it.
You can click to watch a video on how to insert and remove a diaphragm and how to use a diaphragm gel in pidgin.nbsp
You can visit your nearest pharmacy or health shop to purchase

Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings  a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.nbsp
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

On who can use and who cannot use female condoms. Who can use 1. If you want a safe and effective non-hormonal form of contraceptive. 2. If you cannot use hormonal methods of contraception for medical reasons. 3. If you have sexual intercourse occasionally. 4. If you have multiple sexual partners
Ok, let me show you what a female condom looks like and how to use it.
You can click to watch a video on how to insert and remove a female condom in Pidgin.
Then if you have genital /uterine prolapse (when the uterus descends toward or into the vagina), you cannot use the female condom.
You can visit your nearest chemist/pharmacy to buy.
A condom is a thin covering that fits over a hard penis. It decreases the risk of pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) by stopping sperm and body fluids from passing between partners.
You can click the audio to listen to how to insert and remove a condom correctly in Pidgin if you want to.
Let me tell you some of the effective and available condoms. Click on any of them to get their full details.
Kiss condoms are gently lubricated to provide you with a silky, natural feeling for increased pleasure and sensitivity.

Fiesta is a premium condom brand that comes in 14 exciting variants of styles, colours, textures, flavors, shapes and sizes that increase the sensation for both partners. 1. They provide great protection from both pregnancy and STIs/HIV 2. Exciting variants offer enhanced sexual pleasure for both partners. 3. Ensure STIs/HIV protection for women on other family planning methods. 4. Can be used for oral, anal and vaginal sex. 5. 100 electronically tested and manufactured to meet the highest international quality standards.
You can visit your nearest health shop to buy.

Trojan brand latex condoms are made from premium quality latex to help reduce the risk of unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections. Every condom is electronically tested to help ensure reliability. There are more than 30 varieties of Trojan brand condoms.
Durex isnbspa brand of condoms and personal lubricants owned by the British-Dutch company Reckitt Benckiser.

Gold Circlenbsp(GC)nbspCondomnbspis SFH Nigeria's pinnacle product. They offer dual protection to encourage family planning and prevent sexually Transmitted Infections. Gold Circle Condoms are made of latex, well lubricated and shrinked-wrapped for maximum pleasure.
If you want to prevent pregnancy within 1-2 years, you can use any of the short-acting family planning methods, the Injectables or the Implants.
You can either use the daily pills, the emergency pills, the injectables or the implants. Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy. They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time. They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.
Click to listen to a short explanation of implants in Pidgin, if you want to.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants. Advantages 1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant. 2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex. 3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion. 4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it 5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy. 6. Does not disturb breast milk production. 7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use implants. Who can use 1. You can use an implant if you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 1 to 3 years. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from 6 weeks after birth) 3. If you cannot tolerate estrogen. 4. If you don't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you have endometrial or ovarian cancer, you can still use this method.

Disadvantages 1. Insertion and removal involve minor surgery and must be performed by a trained professional. 2. You cannot discontinue the method by yourself. 3. They might have some side effects such as: a. Headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Dizziness. d. Breast tenderness. e. Weight gain. f. Menstrual changes. g. Spotting and irregular vaginal bleeding.

Who cannot use You cannot use implants if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Venous thromboembolism. c. Stroke. d. Heart Disease. e. Liver Disease. f. Breast Cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Vaginal bleeding.
Do you have any of the medical conditions listed?
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use contraceptive implants. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.
Let me tell you some of the effective and available contraceptive implants. Click on any of them to get their full details.
Do you understand? It is very important.

LEVOPLANT which is a subdermal contraceptive implant, Levoplant has two small flexible rods about matchstick size. It is WHO-prequalified and highly effective for 3 years, it is suitable for most women except pregnant women.

Advantages  Immediate return to fertility.  Fewer side effects.  Thinner trocar for the insertion process.nbsp  High quality and most affordable 3-year implant in Nigeria. Common side effects:  Menstrual changes.  Headaches.  Dizziness.nbsp  Weight changes (loss/Gain)- which is a buildup of water not fat.  Breast tenderness

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay.
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method.

Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. Implanon NXT is over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for 3 years. Also, it can be stopped anytime the woman wants by asking a health provider to remove it. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay.
Some of its common side effects are  Headaches.  Dizziness.  Breast tenderness.  Nausea  Stomach cramping/bloating.  Weight gain.  Vaginal irritation/discharge may occur.
If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 3 - 4 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC methods.

Long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC are: 1. The Injectables. 2. The Implants. 3. The IUS. 4. The IUD While the short-acting methods are: 1. The daily contraceptive Pills. 2. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
You can still adopt the short-acting family planning methods or the barrier contraceptives if you don't want any device insertion into your body.

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they worknbsp For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS. Advantages For pregnancy prevention: 1. No daily use is required. 2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle. 3. Do not require regular clinic visits. 4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal. 5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery. 6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects. 7. It maintains normal libido. 8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer. 9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception. For gynecological use: 1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion. 2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding. 3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss. 4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUS in Pidgin, if you want to.
This means that you can use IUS for both gynecological matters and to prevent pregnancy.

Now to the disadvantages of IUS. Disadvantages 1. Your periods may become irregular or stop completely, which may not be suitable for some people. 2. Self-limiting follicular cysts may develop in the first few cycles. 3. If you get an infection when you have an IUS fitted, it could lead to a pelvic infection if it's not treated. 4. In rare cases, an IUS can make a hole in the womb when it's put in. 5. They might have some side effects such as: a. Headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Breast tenderness. d. Lower abdominal cramps. e. Irregular uterine/vaginal bleeding.
Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUS. Who can use 1. You can use IUS if you cannot use combined contraceptives. 2. If can use IUS even if you are HIV positive.

Who cannot use You cannot use IUS if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Uncontrolled hypertension. b. Stroke. c. Heart Disease. d. Liver Disease. e. Breast Cancer. f. Cervical cancer. g. Kidney infection. h. Unexplained vaginal bleeding
Ok, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use IUS. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.
Ok, let me show you one of the effective IUS products that you can adopt.
Eloira, which is an IUS different from an IUD due to the absence of copper. A hormone (Levonorgestrel) replaces the copper. It is used to treat gynecological conditions and pregnancy prevention.

An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y. Theynbspare long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99 effective in preventing unintendednbsppregnancy. They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.
Click to listen to a short explanation of IUD in Pidgin, if you want to.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUD. Advantages 1. IUDs are highly effective and safe for a majority of women. 2. They are 100 hormone-free, so no hormonal side effects. 3. Can be removed at any time with immediate return to fertility. 4. Can be used as an emergency contraceptive if inserted within 5 days of having unprotected sex. 5. They are private and independent of intercourse. 6. They are long-lasting and can prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years with no drug interaction.

Now to the disadvantages of IUD. Disadvantages Complications are rare but may occur and they include 1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy. 2. Uterine perforation. 3. They might cause some side effects such as: a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding. b. Menstrual cramps. c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUD. Who can use 1. You can use an IUD if you are very sexually active. 2. You can use an IUD even if you are a breastfeeding mother, a smoker, or have diabetes and hypertension. 3. You can use an IUD if you have currently or history of certain health conditions like stroke, heart disease, liver disease, breast cancer, headaches, lupus, vein thrombosis, etc, and cannot use hormonal contraceptives. 4. You can use an IUD even if you are taking drugs like anti-tuberculosis drugs, anti-convulsant drugs, or anti-retroviral agents, etc.

Who cannot use You cannot use an IUD if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Cervical cancer. b. Endometrial disease. c. Unexplained vaginal bleeding. d. Uterine fibroid with cavity distortion. e. Pelvic tuberculosis. f. Untreated vaginal infection. g. STIs like gonorrhoea and chlamydia.
So do you currently have or previously had any of the medical conditions listed?
OK, sorry about your medical condition but it is not advisable for you to use IUD. Please speak to your doctor before using this method of contraception.
Do you understand? It is very important.
Ok, let me show you one of the effective IUD products that you can adopt.

Lydia IUD devices are non-hormonal, long-lasting contraception (5-10 yrs.) DKT has 5 variants which can be T (the most common) or Y-shaped - made of plastic coat with copper. This device is inserted into the uterus and it is the most effective contraceptive according to WHO with about 99.9 efficacy. It can also serve as an emergency contraceptive if used within 5days of unprotected sexual intercourse. Its mechanism of action is to inhibit sperm penetration due to the toxicity of copper to sperm
So do you currently have or previously had any of the medical conditions listed?
If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 5 - 10 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC method.
The pregnancy prevention methods are: 1. The IUS 2. The IUD Click on any of them to get the full details about them.
Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again.nbsp Male: Vasectomy Female: Tubal ligation Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen. It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm. Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia. You will need to consult a health care provider.

Tubal Litigation is surgery women can get to "tie" their fallopian tubes. It's a type ofnbspfemale sterilization. The goal is to prevent eggs from travelling from the ovaries to the uterus so you can'tnbspget pregnant.
Some of its common side effects are: a. Abdominal pain or cramping. b. Fatigue. c. Dizziness. d. Gassiness or bloating. e. Shoulder pain. You will need to consult a health care provider.

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences. Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness. However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives. Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido. Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.nbsp

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex. You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you. Postpill shine maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa na kashi ɗaya na DKT. Ya ƙunshe 1.5 MG Levongestrel. Kuna iya siyan maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa wato postpill a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse. It doesnt work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is. You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you. POSTINOR Kwaya ce ta gaggawa ta hana daukar ciki (ECP) wacce ke hana daukar ciki a cikin sa'o'i 72 bayan jima'i ba tare da kariya ba.nbsp Ba ya aiki idan an riga an samu shigar ciki kuma ba zai cutar da ciki da aka rigaya aka samu ba. Shan POSTINOR da wuri bayan jimain, yafi inganci. Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome). They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released. Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).

Return to fertility is very fast. 4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain. 5. They are simple and easy to use.

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily. Levofem lafiyayye ne, maras nauyi, haɗe-haɗe na maganin hana haihuwa da ake amfani dashi don hana ciki. Kowace fakitin ya ƙunshi kwayar rawaya masu aiki guda 21 da kwayar placebo (marasa aiki) 7 waɗanda yakamata a sha kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana.nbsp
Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.nbsp

Yadda Ake Amfani 1. Ɗauki kwaya ta farko daga fakitin da aka yi masa alama da daidai ranar mako, ko kwaya ta farko ta kalar farko (phasic pills) 2. Ci gaba da shan kwaya a lokaci guda kowace rana har sai an gama fakitin. Ci gaba da shan kwayoyin cuta har tsawon kwanaki bakwai (a cikin wadannan kwanaki bakwai za ku sami jini). 3. Fara fakitin kwayayen kwayaye na gaba a rana ta takwas, ko har yanzu jini na jini ko babu. Wannan ya kamata ya kasance daidai ranar mako kamar lokacin da kuka sha kwayar cutar ta farko

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills). Dianofem kwaya ce mai aminci kuma mai inganci wacce ta ƙunshi hadin sinadarin antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) da estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) da ake amfani da su don magance cututtukan al'amuran da suka shafi mata da cuttutukan fata. Yana kuma hana ciki. Ya ƙunshi allunan 21 ba tare da placebo (kwayoyin marasa aiki).

How to Use Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break. Yadda Ake Amfaninbsp Ɗauki kwayar maganin guda ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21, sannan a yi hutu na kwanaki 7 inda ba zaa sha allunan ba. Fara fakiti na gaba bayan hutun kwanaki 7.

How to Use One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack. Yadda Ake Amfaninbsp Ana shan kwaya ɗaya kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21 sannan a yi hutun kwanaki 7, sannan a ci gaba da fakitin na gaba.nbsp Za mu iya mayar da ku zuwa ga wakili / cibiyar lafiya mafi kusa.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy. The injectionnbspworks by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix. They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel. 4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy. 5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis. 6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month. Toh, bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin na allurar rigakafin hana haihuwa.nbsp Faidodin su 1. Suna da tasiri sosai da aminci.nbsp 2. Ba sa kutsawa cikin jima'i.nbsp 3. Mutun na iya yi da kanshi ko kuma kwararen ma'aikacin da ba na lafiya ba zeh iya mai 4. Suna kariya daga samun cikin wajan mahaifa 5.Suna rage alamun ciwon ciki ta alada.nbsp 6. Suna da sauƙin amfani da gudanarwa kuma sau ɗaya a wata a ke yin ta. "

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms. Advantages 1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects. 2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods. 3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion)nbsp 4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption.nbsp 5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control. 6. One size fits most women. 7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag. 8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice. 9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care. nbsp nbsp Yanzu bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin diaphragms.nbsp Amfaninbsp 1. Diaphragms ba su danbsp sinadarin hormone, don haka ba yadda illanbsp 2. Kyakkyawan zaɓi ga matan da suka fi son hanyar hana haihuwa mara sinadarin hormone. 3. Girma ɗaya kan dace da yawancin matanbsp 7. Maɗaukaki kuma mai dacewa - ya zo da akwati na musamman wanda ke da siri kuma karami da za anbsp iya sa wa cikin shinbsp 8. Sauƙin amfani - shigarwa da cirewa yafi kyau idan ana yawan gwaji 9. Ana iya amfani dashi har zuwa shekaru 2 tare da kulawa mai kyau. "

Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings  a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.nbsp
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay. Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they worknbsp For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS. Advantages For pregnancy prevention: 1. No daily use is required. 2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle. 3. Do not require regular clinic visits. 4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal. 5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery. 6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects. 7. It maintains normal libido. 8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer. 9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception. For gynecological use: 1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion. 2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding. 3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss. 4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy. They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time. They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.

Kwayoyin yau da kullun kwayoyine na hana haihuwa,na cutar fata ,da batutuwan da suka shafi mata, da kula da rashin daidaituwa na al'ada(jini mai nauyi,jinin haila mai radadi,ciwon fara al'ada) Suna yin aiki ne ta hanyar sa kauri a kusa da mahaifa wanda ke sa maniyyi wahalar shiga cikin mahaifa kuma ya hana kowane ƙwai da aka saki ya hadu da maniyyi.nbsp Yawancin kwayoyin yau da kullun na tsarin iyali suna zuwa ko dai fakitin kwanaki 21 (Dianofem da Desofem) ko fakitin kwanaki 28 (Levofem). How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill
You can buy Levofem at any pharmacy or health store around you.

Diaphragm shine maganin hana haihuwa na farji wanda mace kan iya sarrafawa, ba na hormonal ba, kuma ya dace da matan da ba za su iya ko ba sa so su yi amfani da hanyoyin hana haihuwanbsp masu sinadarin hormone, na'urorin ciki, ko kwaroron roba.nbsp

Kwaroron roba na mata hanya ce ta hana daukar ciki da ake sawa a cikin farji. Suna hana ciki ta hanyar dakatar da maniyyi daganbsp saduwa da kwan ciki.

Wasu fa'idodinsa sune:nbsp 1. Ba a buƙatar takardar sayan magani.nbsp 2. Kwaroron roba na mata suna da yawa.nbsp 3.nbsp Basu da illa. 4. Suna kariya daga wasu cututtuka da ake kamuwa da su ta hanyar jima'i.nbsp 5. Suna da arha.nbsp 6. Mace na iya sarrafa shi wurin amfani kuma ana amfani dashi kawai lokacin da ake buƙata.

To avoid pregnancy after unprotected sex, you can take emergency contraceptive pills. Emergency contraceptive pills are taken immediately nbspafter unprotected sex to prevent pregnancy. Emergency pills are very effective when taken within 24 to 72 hours after unprotected sex. You are advised to not take it more than 3 times in a month. If you are ovulating, you should use an alternative contraceptive plan (condoms). Please note that they are not effective if you are already pregnant.

Let me tell you some of the effective and available emergency contraceptive pills. Postpill can be taken within 5 days after sex, while Postinor 2 is effective within 3 days . Which product do you want to learn about?

Abubuwan hana daukar ciki wadanda sune diaphragms da kwaroron roba sai kuma allurai na hana haihuwa.nbsp nbsp Danna kowane ɗayansu don samun cikakkun bayanai game da su.nbsp

Postpill is a one-dose emergency contraceptive pill by DKT. It contains 1.5 mg Levongestrel. POSTPILL should be taken orally as soon as possible within 24 hours but can still be taken within 5 days (120 hours) of unprotected sex. You can buy Postpill at any pharmacy or health store around you. Postpill shine maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa na kashi ɗaya na DKT. Ya ƙunshe 1.5 MG Levongestrel. POSTPILL yakamata a sha shi da wuri cikin sa'o'i 24 zuwa kwanaki 5 (awa 120) bayan jimainbsp ba tare da tsaro ba. Kuna iya siyan maganin hana haihuwa na gaggawa wato postpill a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Postinor is an Emergency Contraceptive Pill (ECP) that safely prevents unwanted pregnancy within 72 hours after unprotected sexual intercourse. It doesnt work if you are already pregnant and will not harm an already established pregnancy. The sooner you take POSTINOR, the more effective it is. You can buy Postinor at any pharmacy or health store around you. POSTINOR Kwaya ce ta gaggawa ta hana daukar ciki (ECP) wacce ke hana daukar ciki a cikin sa'o'i 72 bayan jima'i ba tare da kariya ba.nbsp Ba ya aiki idan an riga an samu shigar ciki kuma ba zai cutar da ciki da aka rigaya aka samu ba. Shan POSTINOR da wuri bayan jimain, yafi inganci. Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome). They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released. Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).
Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to.nbsp Danna don sauraron gajeren gabatarwa na kwayoyi na yau da kullun a cikin Pidgin, idan kuna so.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes. Advantages 1. They are very effective if used correctly. 2. Very safe for the majority of women. 3. Return to fertility is very fast. 4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain. 5. They are simple and easy to use.

Suna iya haifar da lahani na dan lokaci wanda yawanci ke wucewa bayan wasu makonni kamar a. Ciwon kai.nbsp b. Tashin zuciya ko amai c. Tabo ko zubar jini a tsaka-tsaki.nbsp d. Ciwon nono da zafin tabi e. Canzawar hali.nbsp

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use daily pills. Who can use 1.You can use daily pills if you want a short-term contraceptive method. 2. If you are a breastfeeding mother (from six months after birth) 3. If you have irregular menstrual cycle. 4. If you don't have migrainous headaches. 5. If you are taking antibiotics, antifungal or antiparasitic medications. A kan wanda zai iya amfani da wanda ba zai iya amfani da kwayoyin yau da kullum ba.nbsp nbspnbsp Wanene zai iya amfani:nbsp 1. Ana iya amfani da kwaya na yau da kullun idan kuna son tsarin hana haihuwa na ɗan gajeren lokaci.nbsp 2. Idan kina shayarwa (daga wata shida bayan haihuwa).nbsp 3. Idan kina da rikitacen al'ada 4. Idan baki da ciwon kai na migraine.nbsp 5. Idan kina shan maguguna irin su antibiotic,antifungal ko antiparasite

Hawan jininbsp b. venous thromboembolismnbsp c. Mutuwar barin jiki d. Ciwon Zuciyanbsp e. Cutar Hantanbsp f. cutar daji na nono g. Ciwon siga h. sikler

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily. Levofem lafiyayye ne, maras nauyi, haɗe-haɗe na maganin hana haihuwa da ake amfani dashi don hana ciki. Kowace fakitin ya ƙunshi kwayar rawaya masu aiki guda 21 da kwayar placebo (marasa aiki) 7 waɗanda yakamata a sha kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana.nbsp
Kuna iya siyan shi a kowane kantin magani ko kantin kiwon lafiya da ke kusa da ku.nbsp

Yadda Ake Amfani 1. Ɗauki kwaya ta farko daga fakitin da aka yi masa alama da daidai ranar mako, ko kwaya ta farko ta kalar farko (phasic pills) 2. Ci gaba da shan kwaya a lokaci guda kowace rana har sai an gama fakitin. Ci gaba da shan kwayoyin cuta har tsawon kwanaki bakwai (a cikin wadannan kwanaki bakwai za ku sami jini). 3. Fara fakitin kwayayen kwayaye na gaba a rana ta takwas, ko har yanzu jini na jini ko babu. Wannan ya kamata ya kasance daidai ranar mako kamar lokacin da kuka sha kwayar cutar ta farko

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills). Dianofem kwaya ce mai aminci kuma mai inganci wacce ta ƙunshi hadin sinadarin antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) da estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) da ake amfani da su don magance cututtukan al'amuran da suka shafi mata da cuttutukan fata. Yana kuma hana ciki. Ya ƙunshi allunan 21 ba tare da placebo (kwayoyin marasa aiki).

How to Use Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break. Yadda Ake Amfaninbsp Ɗauki kwayar maganin guda ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21, sannan a yi hutu na kwanaki 7 inda ba zaa sha allunan ba. Fara fakiti na gaba bayan hutun kwanaki 7.

How to Use One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack. Yadda Ake Amfaninbsp Ana shan kwaya ɗaya kusan lokaci ɗaya kowace rana tsawon kwanaki 21 sannan a yi hutun kwanaki 7, sannan a ci gaba da fakitin na gaba.nbsp Za mu iya mayar da ku zuwa ga wakili / cibiyar lafiya mafi kusa.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy. The injectionnbspworks by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix. They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives. Advantages 1. They are highly effective and safe. 2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse. 3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel. 4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy. 5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis. 6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month. Toh, bari in gaya muku wasu fa'idodi da matsalolin na allurar rigakafin hana haihuwa.nbsp Faidodin su 1. Suna da tasiri sosai da aminci.nbsp 2. Ba sa kutsawa cikin jima'i.nbsp 3. Mutun na iya yi da kanshi ko kuma kwararen ma'aikacin da ba na lafiya ba zeh iya mai 4. Suna kariya daga samun cikin wajan mahaifa 5.Suna rage alamun ciwon ciki ta alada.nbsp 6. Suna da sauƙin amfani da gudanarwa kuma sau ɗaya a wata a ke yin ta. "

Now to the disadvantages of injectable contraceptives. Disadvantages 1. They require regular visit to the to the clinic (monthly) 2. Return to fertility is delayed. 3.Their commom sides effects include: a. Weight changes. b. Headache. c. Dizziness. d. Breast tenderness. e. Mood changes. f. Menstrual change. g. Decreased libido. Canjin hanayin jiki b. Ciwon kai. c. Juwa. d. Ciwon nono. e. Canjin yanayi.nbspnbsp f. Canjin jinin haila. g. Rage sha'awan jimai

Progesta is an injectable contraceptive, a highly safe and effective contraceptive, injected intramuscularly and sometimes into the anus for 3 months continuously.nbsp Its mechanism of action are  thicken cervical mucus.  inhibits ovulation.  thins uterus walls to prevent ovulation. Progesta maganin hana haihuwa ne wanda za'a iya yin allura sa, mai aminci da inganci, allurar cikin tsoka kuma wani lokacin ana yin ta a tubura har tsawon wata uku a jere Tsarin Aikinbsp  kaurara ruwan bakin mahaifa  yana hana ovulation wato zagoyowan kwai na haihuwa.nbsp  siriritar da bangon mahaifa don hana ovulation.nbsp
You can visit a family planning clinic/provider if you want to adopt this method. nbsp Kina iya ziyartar asibitin tsarin iyali idan kina son amfani da daya daga cikin wannan hanyar

Advantages of progesta includenbsp  Safe, highly effective, discontinued at will.  Long-acting,nbsp  Provided outside the clinic,nbsp  Reversible, easy to use, private, and non-contraceptive benefit.nbsp Users include heavy smokers, thyroid disorders, diabetes, those 18 years old or younger, breastfeeding mothers, and pelvic inflammatory diseases.nbsp Fa'idodin sune inganci sosai, dakatarwa sanda ake so, dogon aiki, samun sa ko ba a asibiti ba, mai sauƙin amfani, ana iya an fani da shi a sirri,dawo da haihuwa in an gama,faidar hana haihuwa. Masu amfani sun haɗa da masu shan taba mai yawa,nbsp cutar makoko, ciwon siga, shekarun 18 konbsp ma yan ƙanana, uwaye masu shayarwa, cututtukan kumburin ƙashin ƙugu ko mara.nbsp

How to usenbsp  Injected in the upper arm or buttocks, start at any time during the menstrual cycle.nbsp  5 days after menstrual period, abstain from sex for the next 7 days.nbsp  It can be administered after abortion.nbsp  Start 6 weeks after delivery for a breastfeeding woman. Yadda ake amfani da shinbsp  Ana yin allura a hannu ko duwawu, ana farawa a kowane lokaci yayin jinin haila.  Kwanaki biyar bayan jinin al'ada, kiyaye wa jima'i na tsawon kwanaki bakwai masu zuwa.nbsp  Ana iya ba da ita bayannbsp barewar ciki.nbsp  am fani da ita bayan makonni 6 bayan haihuwa ga mace mai shayarwa.nbsp

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay. "Jadelle shine dasa allura na hana haifuwa wanda ya ƙunshi ƙananan sanduna masu sassauƙa guda biyu (kamar gajeriyar sandar ashana amma sirara) waɗanda ake sakawa a ƙarƙashin fatar hannun mace. Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay. "Implanon NXT wata irin allura ce na hana haihuwa wanda ya ƙunshi ƙaramin allura mai sassauƙa guda ɗaya wanda ake sakawa a ƙarƙashin fatar hannun mace. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they worknbsp For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS. Advantages For pregnancy prevention: 1. No daily use is required. 2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle. 3. Do not require regular clinic visits. 4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal. 5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery. 6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects. 7. It maintains normal libido. 8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer. 9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception. For gynecological use: 1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion. 2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding. 3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss. 4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.

In rare cases, an IUS can make a hole in the womb when it's put in. 5. They might have some side effects such as: a. Headache. b. Nausea or vomiting. c. Breast tenderness. d. Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again.nbsp Male: Vasectomy Female: Tubal ligation Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen. It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm. Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia. You will need to consult a health care provider. "Vasectomy wani nau'i ne na hana haihuwa na namiji wanda ke yanke wadatar da maniyyi.nbsp Ana yin shi ta hanyar yankewa da rufe bututun da ke ɗauke da maniyyi. Vasectomy yana da ƙananan haɗari na matsaloli kuma yawanci ana iya yin shi a wurin marasa lafiya a ƙarƙashin maganin sa barci.nbsp Kuna buƙatar tuntuɓar likita. "

Tubal Litigation is surgery women can get to "tie" their fallopian tubes. It's a type ofnbspfemale sterilization. The goal is to prevent eggs from travelling from the ovaries to the uterus so you can'tnbspget pregnant. Tubal ligation tiyata ce akewa mata dan daure kafofin dake fitar da kwan haibuwa. Manufar ita ce hana ƙwai tafiya daga ma'ajiyar su zuwa mahaifa, don haka ba za ku iya yin ciki ba.nbsp

Some of its common side effects are: a. Abdominal pain or cramping. b. Fatigue. c. Dizziness. d. Gassiness or bloating. e. Shoulder pain. An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y. Theynbspare long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99 effective in preventing unintendednbsppregnancy. They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants. Advantages 1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant. 2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex. 3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion. 4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it 5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy. 6. Does not disturb breast milk production. 7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.
Click to listen to a short explanation of implants in Pidgin, if you want to.

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy. They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time. They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.

How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill

The effects of contraceptive methods on sex life can vary depending on individual experiences and preferences. Some methods, like hormonal contraceptives (such as birth control pills, patches, or IUDs), may have side effects like changes in libido, mood swings, or dryness. However, these effects are not universal, and many individuals use contraceptives without experiencing negative impacts on their sex lives. Other non-hormonal methods like condoms or copper IUDs typically don't affect libido. Ultimately, it's essential to discuss any concerns or potential side effects with a healthcare provider to find the best option that suits your needs and lifestyle.nbsp

Lubricants, also called gels or lubes, are special fluids used during sex. They help reduce friction, discomfort, and dryness, making sex more pleasurable and preventing condoms from breaking. Lubricants come in water-based, silicone-based, or oil-based types. Water-based lubes are safe with all condoms, they don't change the vagina's pH, don't stain clothes, and wash off easily with water. Silicone and oil-based lubes should only be used with specific condom materials. Click to listen to a short introduction of Lubricant in Pidgin, if you want.

Penegra only induces a hard erection when the penis is stimulated.

Daily pills are combined oral contraceptive (COC) pills for pregnancy prevention, dermatological and gynecological conditions, and management of menstrual irregularities (heavy bleeding, painful menstruation, premenstrual syndrome). They work by thickening the mucus around the cervix, which makes it difficult for sperm to enter the uterus and reach any eggs that may have been released. Daily pills are either a 21-day pack (Dianofem and Desofem) or a 28-day pack (Levofem). One pill is taken each day at about the same time for 21 days. Depending on your pack, you will either have a 7-day break (as in the 21-day pack) or you will take the pill that contains Iron for 7 days (the 28-day pack).
Click to listen to a short introduction of daily pills in Pidgin, if you want to.nbsp Ti o ba wu o, te atoka ti o le mu ki o gbo ifaara soki ti a se lori oogun adena oyun olojoojumo.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of daily pills includes. Advantages 1. They are very effective if used correctly. 2. Very safe for the majority of women. 3. Return to fertility is very fast. 4. They regularize the menstrual cycle, reduce heavy menstrual flow, and reduce menstrual and ovulation pain. 5. They are simple and easy to use.

Levofem is a safe, low-dose, combined oral contraceptive used to prevent pregnancy. Each pack contains 21 active yellow tablets and 7 placebo(inactive) tablets which should be taken around the same time daily. Lifofemu jẹ òògùn magboyun ti a n lo iwonba re lati enu ti ipala re ko po, to n dènà oyún níní. Apo kọọkan ní tabulẹti mokanlelogun ti o gbọdọ jẹ lílò lojoojumo ni deede akoko kan naa.nbsp
O le ri ra ní ilé ìtajà òògùn tó sún mọ ọ.

Bi o se le lòónbsp 1. Lo òògùn akọkọ ninu paketi pẹlu ọjọ ti o yẹ nínú ọsẹ pẹlu awọ akọkọ.nbsp 2. Tẹsiwaju lati máa lo òògùn kan nigba kan naa lojo kọọkan titi ti yóò fi tan fun ọjọ méje.nbsp 3. Bẹrẹ paaki òògùn miran ni ọjọ kẹjọ boya ẹjẹ ba nyọ jáde tàbí kó yọ. O gbọdọ jẹ ọjọ kan naa ninu ọsẹ ti o bẹrẹ òògùn ti akoko.nbsp

Dianofem is a safe and effective pill that contains a combination of an antiandrogen (Cyprolerone Acetate 2mg) and estrogen (Ethinylestradiol 0.035mg) used for the treatment of dermatological and gynecological conditions in women. It also prevents pregnancy. It contains 21 tablets with no placebo (inactive pills). Dianofemu jẹ òògùn to n ṣiṣẹ daadaa lailewu. Eyi máa n ṣiṣẹ fun iìsànwosan fun arun to jẹ mọ awọ ara àti àìlera nipa ibisi ilera inu ara obìnrin. O tun n dènà atiloyun. O ni tabulẹti mokanlelogun ninu.

How to Use Take one tablet daily for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break where no tablets are taken. Start the next pack after the 7-day break. Bi o se le lòó Lo tabulẹti kan lojumo fún ọjọ mokanlelogun, siwọ òògùn yìí ni lílò fún ọjọ méje. Bẹrẹ paaki to kan lẹyin ọjọ méje yii. Bẹrẹ paaki tókàn lẹyin ìdádúró ọjọ méje.

How to Use One pill is taken around the same time daily for 21 days followed by a 7-day break, then continue with the next pack. Bi o se lè lòónbsp nbspnbsp Òògùn kan gbọdọ jẹ lílò nigba kan naa lojumo fun ọjọ mokanlelogun, lẹyin rẹ ni ìdádúró ọjọ méje, o le tẹsiwaju pẹlu paaki ti o kan. ku zuwa ga wakili / cibiyar lafiya mafi kusa.

Injectable contraceptives are a form of hormonal birth control for women. They consist of 2-3 monthly injections containing an estrogen and a progestin to prevent pregnancy. The injectionnbspworks by preventing the ovaries from releasing an egg each month. It also thickens the fluid around the cervix. They can be used for pregnancy prevention for 1 to 3 months.

Ok, let me tell you some of the advantages and disadvantages of injectable contraceptives. Advantages 1. They are highly effective and safe. 2. They do not interfer with sexual intercourse. 3. They can be self administered or provided by a trained non-medical personnel. 4. They protect against ectopic pregnancy. 5.They reduce symptoms of endometriosis. 6. They are convenient, easy to use and administered once in a month. "O dara, e jẹ kí n sọ lára àwọn ànfàní àti aleebu to jẹmo adena oyun Alabere yìí.nbsp Awọn anfaaninbsp 1. Kii je ki oyun duro si ibi ti ko tona ni agbegbe ile omo.nbsp 5. Won a maa dín àìsàn ile-ọmọ wiwu ku.nbsp 6. Wọn rọrùn daadaa lati lo ati lati fún ni leekan losu. "

A diaphragm or cap is a type of barrier contraceptive device inserted into the vagina before sex to cover the cervix so that sperm can't get into the womb (uterus). You need to use spermicide with it (spermicides kill sperm). The diaphragm must be left in place for at least 6 hours after sex. The diaphragm is a vaginal barrier contraceptive that is woman-controlled, nonhormonal, and appropriate for women who cannot or do not want to use hormonal contraceptive methods, intrauterine devices, or condoms.
Click to listen to a short introduction of diaphragm in Pidgin, if you want.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of Diaphragms. Advantages 1. Diaphragms do not have hormones, so no side effects. 2. Good option for women who prefer non-hormonal contraceptive methods. 3. They may be fitted at any time (post-partum mothers must wait for 6 weeks after delivery or mid-trimester abortion)nbsp 4. They can be inserted up to 6 hours before sex to avoid interruption.nbsp 5. Only used when needed and gives the woman absolute control. 6. One size fits most women. 7. Portable and convenient - it comes with a specially designed case that is discreet and fits in a bag. 8. Easy to use - insertion and removal gets better with practice. 9. Can be used for up to 2 years with proper care. nbsp nbsp Ni bayi je kí n sọ lára àwon anfaani ati aleebu lilo daafuramu.nbsp Awọn Anfaaninbsp 1. Iwọn ẹyọ kan se deede fún ọpọlọpọ obinrin.nbsp 7. Eyi rọrùn,nbsp o sí se e gbe kaakiri. O wa pẹlu àkànṣe apoti ti o wa ninu apo àpèjúwe.nbsp 8. andnbsp Disadvantages 1. They are not readily available in Nigeria. 2. They may be expensive to some users. 3. Female condoms are a barrier method of contraception worn inside the vagina. They are made of thin soft plastic and have two ﬂexible rings  a removable ring at the closed end to help insertion and a fixed ring at the open end, which sits on the vulva to hold the condom in place They prevent pregnancy by stopping sperm from meeting an egg.nbsp
and one of its disadvantages is that it might make unpleasant noise during intercourse.

A condom is a thin covering that fits over a hard penis. It decreases the risk of pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) by stopping sperm and body fluids from passing between partners.

Jadelle is a contraceptive implant that consists of two small flexible rods (as short as a match stick but thinner) that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 75mg of the hormone Levonorgestrel in each rod. Jadelle implants are over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for a period of 5 years. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases very low dose of hormone which leaves the body quickly when removed, so the woman can get pregnant without delay. nbsp Jadeli jẹ ilana magboyun ifisinu to ni ọpa kekere fẹlẹfẹlẹ meji(o kúrú níye bíi ìsáná ṣugbọn o tinrin) eyi ti won n fi abẹ awo ara obìnrin ni òkè apa. Opa kọọkan ní homonu ninu. Implanon NXT is a contraceptive implant that consists of one small flexible rod that is inserted under the skin of a womans upper arm. It contains 65mg of the hormone Etonorgestrel in each rod. Implanon NXT is over 99 effective and can prevent pregnancy for 3 years. Also, it can be stopped anytime the woman wants by asking a health provider to remove it. This method is completely and quickly reversible because it releases a very low dose of hormone, which leaves the body quickly when removed, so you woman can get pregnant without delay. If you want to prevent pregnancy for up to 3 - 4 years, it is advisable to adopt long-acting reversible contraception or LARC methods.

Long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC are: 1. The Injectables. 2. The Implants. 3. The IUS. 4. The IUD While the short-acting methods are: 1. The daily contraceptive Pills. 2. The emergency contraceptive pills. 3. The barrier contraceptives Choose any them from the options to get the full details about them.
You can still adopt the short-acting family planning methods or the barrier contraceptives if you don't want any device insertion into your body.

Intrauterine system (IUS) are hormonal intrauterine device (IUD). They contain Levenorgestrel for the treatment of some gynecological conditions (endometriosis, adenomyosis, endometrial hyperplasia, etc.) and pregnancy prevention. It has contraceptive coverage for up to 5 years.

How they worknbsp For pregnancy prevention, it works by thickening the mucus in the cervix to stop sperm from fertilizing an egg. It also thins out the lining of the uterus and suppresses ovulation and for gynaecological conditions, it reduces the endometrial lining of the womb making the period lighter and less painful.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUD. Advantages 1. IUDs are highly effective and safe for a majority of women. 2. They are 100 hormone-free, so no hormonal side effects. 3. Can be removed at any time with immediate return to fertility. 4. Can be used as an emergency contraceptive if inserted within 5 days of having unprotected sex. 5. They are private and independent of intercourse. 6. They are long-lasting and can prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years with no drug interaction. O le see lo gẹgẹ bí òògùn pajawiri magboyun ti wọn ba fibo ara laarin ọjọ marun ti ibalopọ alaini dabobo ba waye.nbsp 5. Wọn jẹ eyi ti o pamo ti kò sí di ibalopọ lọwọ.nbsp 6. Wọn jẹ ilana pipẹ ati pé o dènà atiloyun fun bi odun mewaa lai lo òògùn kankan.

Now to the disadvantages of IUD. Disadvantages Complications are rare but may occur and they include 1. Expulsion of IUD, which may lead to pregnancy. 2. Uterine perforation. 3. They might cause some side effects such as: a. Irregular and heavy period or bleeding. b. Menstrual cramps. c. Abnormal vaginal discharge.

Now let me tell you who can use and who cannot use IUD. Who can use 1. You can use an IUD if you are very sexually active. 2. You can use an IUD even if you are a breastfeeding mother, a smoker, or have diabetes and hypertension. 3. You can use an IUD if you have currently or history of certain health conditions like stroke, heart disease, liver disease, breast cancer, headaches, lupus, vein thrombosis, etc, and cannot use hormonal contraceptives. 4. You can use an IUD even if you are taking drugs like anti-tuberculosis drugs, anti-convulsant drugs, or anti-retroviral agents, etc.

Who cannot use You cannot use an IUD if you have any of the following medical conditions. a. Cervical cancer. b. Endometrial disease. c. Unexplained vaginal bleeding. d. Uterine fibroid with cavity distortion. e. Pelvic tuberculosis. f. Untreated vaginal infection. g. STIs like gonorrhoea and chlamydia.

This device is inserted into the uterus and it is the most effective contraceptive according to WHO with about 99.9 efficacy. Permanent family planning methods means the person will no longer be able to reproduce again.nbsp Male: Vasectomy Female: Tubal ligation Click on any of them to get a short explanation on them.

Vasectomy is a form of male birth control that cuts the supply of sperm to your semen. It's done by cutting and sealing the tubes that carry sperm. Vasectomy has a low risk of problems and can usually be performed in an outpatient setting under local anesthesia. You will need to consult a health care provider. An IUD (Intrauterine Device) is a small T or Y-shaped contraceptive device inserted into the uterus to prevent pregnancy for up to 10 years. They are usually called Copper T or Copper Y. Theynbspare long-lasting, easily reversible, safe, and more than 99 effective in preventing unintendednbsppregnancy. They work by providing an environment that is toxic and hostile for the sperm thereby preventing them from fertilizing an egg.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of IUS. Advantages For pregnancy prevention: 1. No daily use is required. 2. Insertion and removal can be done at any time within the menstrual cycle. 3. Do not require regular clinic visits. 4. It has a quick return to fertility after removal. 5. Safe for breastfeeding mothers from six weeks after delivery. 6. Local release of the home ensures milder side effects. 7. It maintains normal libido. 8. Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer. 9. Lower overall risk of ectopic pregnancy than women not on contraception. For gynecological use: 1. Starts working within 24 hours after insertion. 2. Highly effective for the treatment of abnormally heavy menstrual bleeding. 3. Lowers the risk of anemia due to menstrual blood loss. 4. Effective alternative to surgery especially for women who cannot afford to pay for surgery.

Some of the advantages and disadvantages of contraceptive implants. Advantages 1. They can be used at any time in the menstrual cycle, are very effective, and are removed whenever you want to get pregnant. 2. It gives total privacy, no one will know you have it and does not interfere with sex. 3. No frequent clinical follow-up is needed after initial insertion. 4. It is estrogen-free so many people can use it 5. They are long-acting and may help prevent ectopic pregnancy. 6. Does not disturb breast milk production. 7. There is no delay in return to fertility when they are removed.

Contraceptive implants are small, flexible rods inserted under the skin, typically in the arm. They release hormones (usually progestin) to prevent pregnancy. They are long-term birth control methods also called long-acting reversible contraception, or LARC. They provide contraception, lasting up to 3 - 5 years but can be removed at any time. They work by preventing the release of egg and thickening the cervical mucus making it difficult for sperm to reach the egg.

How to Use 1. Take your first pill from the packet marked with the correct day of the week, or the first pill of the first colour (phasic pills) 2. Continue to take a pill at the same time each day until the pack is finished. Continue taking pills for seven days (during these seven days you will get a bleed). 3. Start your next pack of pills on the eighth day, whether you are still bleeding or not. This should be the same day of the week as when you took your first pill
